posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.42 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ We updated our sticker management UI (new tabs, ability to drag and drop, cuter icons). Feel free to test and let us know about any bugs.

Complete list of new commits since 7.41.3:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.41.3…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.41 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.42.0 (154300)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

75 new commits since 7.41.3:

Show commits

  • Fix issue where a test user could have a tier but no subscriber. [1]

  • Implement remote mute receive; Update to RingRTC v2.52.0 [2]

  • Duck and recover external audio on voice note play. [3]

  • Duck and recover external audio on video play. [4]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.70.1 [5]

  • Add additional CDN reconciliations to BackupMediaSnapshotSyncJob. [6]

  • Fix crash when leaving group. [7]

  • Do not play a media item if it was deleted. [8]

  • Prevent sending sticker attachments with a blank contentType. [9]

  • Support accounts without pins in AEP restore flows. [10]

  • Fix BackupRestoreMediaJob not correctly paging through attachments. [11]

  • Fix unread count asserts in read sync tests. [12]

  • Add missing long press haptic feedback to composables. [13]

    As recommended by https://developer.android.com/develop/ui/compose/touch-input/pointer-input/tap-and-press
    > As a best practice, you should include haptic feedback when the user long-presses elements.

  • Sticker management v2 - Implement context menus. [14]

    Adds the context menus that appear when long pressing available or installed sticker pack list items.

  • Fix media player incorrect state when switching videos in album. [15]

  • Hide camera toggle button in PIP mode. [16]

  • Add accessibility label on buttons. [17]

  • Avoid recording empty voice messages during an ongoing call. [18]

  • Fix invalid constraint handling sql when calling update. [19]

  • Add new remote config support for calling audio configuration. [20]

  • Remove wrapped fragments from settings. [21]

  • Fix color resource linking in SignalSymbols. [22]

  • Rotate libsignal-net trial RemoteConfig. [23]

  • Reapply query after contact refresh. [24]

  • Fix UI update on non-UI thread exception. [25]

  • Sticker management v2 - Implement multi-select. [26]

  • Fix navigation bar offset. [27]

  • Save search query to savedinstancestate. [28]

  • Convert InviteActivity to a fragment. [29]

  • Fix backup dialog color. [30]

  • Add nav spacing to action bar in compact mode. [31]

  • Add paging for getArchivedRecipients. [32]

  • Clear aep from clipboard after 60 seconds. [33]

  • Pass down RemoteConfig for TLS minimum version enforcement to libsignal. [34]

  • Sticker management v2 - Implement multi-delete. [35]

  • Fix crash for leave gv1. [36]

  • Sticker management v2 - Implement remaining functionality. [37]

    • Fix bottom action bar shadow clipping during visibility animations.
    • Show snackbar after installing/uninstalling sticker packs.
    • Navigate to sticker preview on row click.
    • Add top app bar menu to enable multi-select mode.
    • Start StickerManagementActivityV2 instead of the old StickerManagementActivity

  • Prevent multiple activity instances and fix strange launch behavior. [38]

  • Update header on recipient change. [39]

  • Fix system emoji not showing in video call reactions. [40]

  • Delete old/unused sticker management v1 code. [41]

    Deletes the old code related to sticker management v1 and removes the v2 prefix from the new classes.

  • Remove activity override in favour of alias down the road. [42]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.71.0. [43]

  • Remove pendingResponses; libsignal-net now completes futures with disconnectReason. [44]

  • Remove MainListHostFragment and rescope list vms to the activity. [45]

  • Fix shortcut update job crash for old installs without an aci. [46]

  • Fix backups not being scheduled. [47]

  • Add round checkbox composable. [48]

    Adds RoundCheckbox composable, which is styled to match the appearance of the other view checkboxes used in the app.

  • Implement stop/resume media restore and update restore over cellular. [49]

  • Use dispatch queue and join to ensure single-threaded requests. [50]

  • Add proper title to expiration sheet. [51]

  • Add beta label to backups. [52]

  • Update retrieve profile job. [53]

  • Migrate to new SVR2 enclave. [54]

  • Hide create call link button while in multiselect mode. [55]

  • Fix tab scroll-to-top on click. [56]

  • Update RecyclerView to 1.4.0 [57]

  • Work around off-by-one error causing thin line to display when it shouldn't. [58]

  • Downgrade notify of key warning to info. [59]

  • Add support for animated images to GlideImage. [60]

    Our GlideImage implementation doesn't support animated images, because it loads them as bitmaps and therefore only displays the first image frame as a static image. This change works around that issue by having GlideImage wrap an ImageView to handle cases where we need to display animated images.

  • Fix camera rotation / phone orientation syncing. [61]

  • Fix mentions being displayed as obj. [62]

  • Fix pnp settings not properly syncing or dynamically updating. [63]

  • Restore chat colors after backup. [64]

  • Flag username for restore on re-register. [65]

  • Remove MMS related encryption error messaging. [66]

  • Disconnect groupCall object when network is unavailable. [67]

  • Add additional logging for stopped processing. [68]

  • Fix filter display when returning to conversation list from another tab. [69]

  • Improve handling of 12/24 hour timestamps on configuration change. [70]

    This fixes an edge case seen on ConversationFragment, where if the
    device time format is switched between 12/24 hour format while the app
    is running, the old time format will still be displayed when the app
    is resumed.
    This is due to a design flaw in DateTimeFormatter.ofLocalizedTime,
    where the time format is statically cached and not updated upon
    configuration change. The LocalTime.formatHours() extension method
    was updated to no longer rely on the misbehaving ofLocalTime method.
    In addition, ConversationMessaageComputeWorkers.recomputeFormattedDate
    was designed to skip recomputing non-relative timestamps. This works
    in most cases but not this specific edge case. A force: Boolean flag
    was added to force all items to be updated. And the force = true flag
    was passed upon onResume of the fragment.
    Closes #14121

  • Remove bank selection from iDEAL. [71]

  • Rotate libsignal net config flag. [72]

  • Sticker management v2 – Improve list animations and state transitions. [73]

    • Uninstall selected packs in a single database transaction to avoid UI flickering.
    • Add section header keys to prevent them from animating wildly while scrolling.

  • Update translations and other static files. [74]

  • Bump version to 7.42.0 [75]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.41.3…v7.42.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.cooked:
The new sticker UI looks nice! One thing though: I would like to have the Installed tab be the first one and Available the second one. Most of the time I go there I want to uninstall a pack or rearrange them.

Also the selection behaves differently from other parts in the app like conversations or messages. Here deselecting all does not quit the selection mode. Is this by design?

The new sticker UI looks nice! One thing though: I would like to have the Installed tab be the first one and Available the second one. Most of the time I go there I want to uninstall a pack or rearrange them.

Thanks for the quick feedback! I’ve forwarded this suggestion to the design team

Also the selection behaves differently from other parts in the app like conversations or messages. Here deselecting all does not quit the selection mode. Is this by design?

Nice catch! That inconsistency was not intentional and will be fixed in 7.42.1.

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
Signal crashes when swiping back from the archive section (only when going back via gesture, back button in the top left corner works fine)

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.42.0/24b8d8e3a5f27ebad2ce5d2d6f2d8162981b84a63e2fd65dfff843e960890531

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
AlertSubject:

Signal crashes when swiping back from the archive section (only when going back via gesture, back button in the top left corner works fine)

Thanks, looking into it.

Just got a “Signal closed because it has a bug” message, and an option to clear cache popped up. All I did was exit the app.

Log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.42.0/a115ecc8fb166ac15b994325cd07e678d743555edd1062b02dca4e3c0ef1bb67

updates-bot:

Update header on recipient change. [39]

This commit is vacant
Same here https://debuglogs.org/android/7.42.0/413789491b6bad0d4bf9dc590d1a922a33625145e804d79d269adf62609be116

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
AlertSubject:

Signal crashes when swiping back from the archive section

Avitus:

Just got a “Signal closed because it has a bug” message

piratenpanda:

Same here

Fix coming in 7.42.1 today.

New Version: 7.42.1 (154400)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

11 new commits since 7.42.0:

Show commits

  • Async start network and message retrieval. [1]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.71.1 [2]

  • Fix rationale dialog height on small devices. [3]

  • Fix crash when backing out of archive. [4]

  • Allow REST fallback via remote config. [5]

  • Sticker Management v2 - Exit multi select mode after all items are deselected. [6]

    To match the behavior of the conversations and messages screens.

  • Fix timer updating on chats list. [7]

  • Detect and recycle WebSockets stuck in connecting state. [8]

  • Update translations and other static files. [9]

  • Update baseline profile. [10]

  • Bump version to 7.42.1 [11]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.42.0…v7.42.1

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Opening GIFs to fullscreen causes audio to duck (at least Bluetooth audio). My best guess is that this might be because GIFs are rendered as MP4 (I think??) and I believe there was some new audio ducking functionality added in this release.

Thanks!

Logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.42.1/616b0148117650ba7aac0d61a9600c76a60e9da851b1148318b60e6321645afd
Is it just the beta or is sending images really slow in the last few days?
Sending media off VPN is instant.

posts.name: Tiwo Satriatama
posts.cooked:
Wrong status bar color when message selected.

Screenshot_20250517_121056_Signal1080×468 37.6 KB

Debug log https://debuglogs.org/android/7.42.0/aa4f80ecafa37de334617128ff4edc3e0ed6285d93b44c6e11744dad21a20826

General delay in showing messages in the chat after hitting the send button.
Also sending the messages itself was slow.
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.42.1/774178a258e0169a5fc63619503f0858e2957a19ed7e6f8de4b4427860f7b3ce

1. The “chat archived” banner TTL is very long; like 5-10 seconds. This has been present for a few versions.
  2. I discovered something about the issue on Samsung phones with the archive stripe when swiping doesn’t go away. If the stripe is there on the main chat list screen, you can go into the archive and back to the main chat list to make the stripe go away. Up to now I’d been force-stopping the app. I also can’t reproduce the issue entirely in the archive, but there is “tearing” that happens on the sides after swiping a few back to the main chat list.
Log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.42.1/c9dba36ba927310e07c568644328b55daa184305ec7ff2abb8b24b8121591bef

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
Salt505:

Opening GIFs to fullscreen causes audio to duck

Yeah, likely related to the recent media changes. We shouldn’t duck if it’s a gif mp4. Tracking.

piratenpanda:

Is it just the beta or is sending images really slow in the last few days?

Debuglog and timestamp of a slow message helps us investigate.

tiwosatriatama:

Wrong status bar color when message selected.

Tracking.

Leibi:

General delay in showing messages in the chat after hitting the send button.
Also sending the messages itself was slow.

Do you have a message sent timestamp so we can poke at this specific problematic message?

Avitus:

The “chat archived” banner TTL is very long; like 5-10 seconds. This has been present for a few versions.

I don’t think this has changed recently, but the snackbar stays up long to allow you to undo a mistaken archive swipe.

cody-signal:

Do you have a message sent timestamp so we can poke at this specific problematic message?

No, but it has been the one before I generated the report.

Signal 7.42.1 is constantly crashing upon opening the UI on an S25 Ultra. The app itself is running in the background, receiving messages, showing notifications, and messages can even be replied to from the notification and mark as read. But the UI won’t open. It kinda does the opening animation and closes straight away. I cannot obtain a debug log (unless there is another way?)
